titleStmt.title: Y. B. Elmore et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4205

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his excellincy
The Govenor of Kentucky

We the undersigned officers and Jury by whom James T. Howard was tried and fined the Sum of fifteen dollars for a breach of the peace pray your Excellency to remit the Same Said Howard being a verry poor man and the offence having been committed from the impulse of the moment without time to reflect, and having been provoked to do the same by Rebel Sympathisers he being a true loyal citizen, yet under the laws of Ky we were bound to inflict the fine which we pray you to remit your memorialists will ever pray &c
Sept, 1863

Y, B, Elmore forman of the jury
J, L, Watkins
David Carby
William J Snyder
B. F. Wheeler J.P.GC
John Dennis
George. W. Clemmans
James Alvey
R M. Alvey

We the undersigned certify that JaS T. Howard is a loyal citizen and a member of a home Guard company, and that those with whom he had the dificulty refered to by the officers and Jury on the first page are Rebel Sympathisers
Sept. 1863

W. E. Wortham capt. Rock cr. home Guard
Martin Miller
J. C. Marr
George B Marr Jnr
J C Wheeler
Enos K Hawkins
John Fenwick
John E Dennis
Jonas taylor
Thoms E Higdon
Wm Johnston
R H Johnston
Henry Fenwick
Lewis W Hackley
E, Mills- P. M. Millerstown
Charles Miller
Israel Downs
A C Made sec ofiser
George Bell
James Bell
Thomas Witten
Jos M Morrison
Moses Paris
W S Horn
Joseph Begly
Thompson Watkins
Ben Hughes
J B. Fulkersons
Jacob Carter
R J Wathan
John S Kenser
Thos. W. Vertrees
Stepen. Robertson
Willliam. Spencer
Bird Fulkerson
Zachariah CarBy
L W Howard
James Faulkerson
S. E. Duckworth 2d Lieu
